find_political_donors.DataStorageEngine

Class DataHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • find_political_donors.DataStorageEngine.DataHeap

  • public class DataHeap
extends java.lang.Object
    This class keeps tracking of
    • the amount of each contribution
    • the total number of contributions
    • the total amount of contributions
    • the median of contributions using the Heap method
    Although the Data Dictionary indicate the TRANSACTION_AMT is NUMBER(14,2), after examining the data files, it is certain that the data files only contain floored integer amount. Therefore Integer and Long are used in this class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataHeap

        public DataHeap()

    • Method Detail

      • offer

        public boolean offer(int num)
        Add an integer to the DataHeap using the two-Heap (PriorityQueue) method. Time complexity O(log(n)).
        Parameters:
        num - the integer needs to be added to the DataHeap.
        Returns:
        true if the integer is added, or false if not added.

      • getMedian

        public int getMedian()
        Get the median of all the data sorted in the Heap. Time complexity O(1).
        Returns:
        the Median of the data stored in the DataHeap. If the fractional portion of the argument is greater than 0.5, the argument is rounded to the integer with the next higher absolute value. If it is less than 0.5, the argument is rounded to the integer with the lower absolute value. If the fractional portion is exactly 0.5, the argument is rounded to the next integer in the direction of +∞. For example, 0.5 will be rounded to 1, while -0.5 will be rounded to 0. However, 0.51 will be rounded to -1.

      • getTotalTransactions

        public long getTotalTransactions()
        Returns:
        the total number of transactions, i.e. how many numbers are stored in the DataHeap.

      • getTotalAmount

        public long getTotalAmount()
        Returns:
        the total amount of transactions, i.e. the sum of all the integers stored in the DataHeap.
